data.title: get_tree().set_debug_collisions_hint(true) doesn't work in tool mode
data.body:
When using the get_tree().set_debug_collisions_hint(true) function in tool mode, nothing happens.

Example:
```
tool
export (bool) var Enabled = false setget initialize
func initialize(value):
	Enabled = value
	if get_tree().is_editor_hint():
		if value == true:
			get_tree().set_debug_collisions_hint(true)
```
Enable the exposed variable from above in the editor,
then check debug options in the editor - the collision hint is not enabled

data.title: Cannot set a DynamicFont as the editor or script editor font
data.body: The editor and script editor font settings (eg. **Editor Settings → Interface → Custom Font**) expect a file with a `.font` extension (probably a BitMapFont). If you display all files and select a `.ttf` or `.otf` font file (DynamicFont), it will not be used, even after restarting the editor.

data.title: etc: Append -std=gnu++11 to CCFLAGS instead of CXXFLAGS
data.body: This way it can override the -std flags passed to scons.

data.body: `git farm --hard`

data.title: Support to rename project from project manager
data.body: Fixes #10740

data.title: Fixes reversed order of default arguments in MethodInfo
Fix files header
added StringBuilder class
data.body:
When doing large string concatenations the default push_back on the
String class can slow down things quite a bit. This is because it
has to constantly reallocate the memory and copy the contents. This
StringBuilder class delays the concatenation until the size of the
resulting string is known.

data.title: setget doesn't work on export variables
data.body:
In this video
https://youtu.be/whRWwVFGxms?t=4m16s

The presenter adds a setget on a variable that is exposed to the editor. Then tests it with a print like this:

```
#tool #<-- when enabled, test prints only in terminal, but not in the output area of the editor
export (int) var myvar setget myvar_set,myvar_get

func myvar_set(newvalue):
	print("Test") #<-- doesn't print
	myvar=newvalue

func myvar_get():
	return myvar # getter must return a value
```
When he changes the variable in editor, while the game is not running, the test message prints out 

In Godot 2.1.4 and 2.1.2 this doesn't work

data.title: add shadow_filter variant PCF7
data.body:
Adds a PCF7 variant to the shadow_filter option of Light2D as discussed in #10624.

**This is a breaking change**. In existing projects, PCF9 will become PCF7 and PCF13 will become PCF9.

NOTE: PCF11 is also missing, though I'm not sure if it matters much, but since we're breaking already if you wanted to add it we should probably do it all at once... It's the only odd number missing below 13.

data.title: Failure to deploy .appx to Windows 10 Mobile
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
PC OS: Debian Buster
Godot version: 2.1.4
Phone: Microsoft Lumia 532
Phone OS: Windows 10 Mobile Build 10.0.14393.1066

**Issue description:**
When deploying .appx generated by export tool, Get the following failure:
_Failure reason: Failed to start deployment. Failure text: No signature was present in the subject.
 (0x800b0100)_
![Imgur](http://i.imgur.com/BqGTr6U.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Export > Windows Universal > Export...
2. Go to Device Portal on PC browser (hosted from phone) > Apps > Install App
3. Select .appx App package and click on 'Go'

I tried some things:
* change apps storage location to internal memory (it was first on SD Card)
* placed my _Windows Phone Publisher ID_ on 'Publisher Guid' field, placed a random guid on 'Product Guid' field (generated with some guid generator) and placed my _Window Publisher ID_ with "CN=" prefix on 'Publisher' field

data.title: Fix iphone code not compiling with Xcode 6
Addon system - ability to load an instanced scene as a custom type or have a custom type with children nodes that are exposed to editor
data.body:
Either I am doing something wrong or it seems not possible to do.

The goal is to create a custom type game object addon that consists of a node that contains a number of children nodes that are all exposed to the editor

I know I can make children nodes via the runtime, but that happens only while the game is running. I want to have these children nodes be created and available in the editor when the custom type is added to the scene

Is there a way to do this in godot? If so I can't seem to find any examples or documentation on how to do it

data.title: Fix crash when destroying AudioStreamPlaybackOGGVorbis
data.body:
Closing `ogg_stream` after freeing `ogg_alloc.alloc_buffer` may cause crash. That's because `ogg_stream` may be allocated _inside_ `ogg_alloc.alloc_buffer` .
Simply closing `ogg_stream` before freeing buffer fixes the crash.

**Why this happens:**
1. `ogg_stream` is allocated using `stb_vorbis_open_memory` with `alloc` argument specified:
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/7c76e0c8c3dda5c88f761176cb93445b3214ea21/modules/stb_vorbis/audio_stream_ogg_vorbis.cpp#L135

2. And here we see, that `setup_malloc` (which handles all allocations inside vorbis module) is trying to allocate memory inside `alloc_buffer`.
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/7c76e0c8c3dda5c88f761176cb93445b3214ea21/thirdparty/misc/stb_vorbis.c#L906-L917

data.title: 'Condition '!monitoring ' is true.returned: Array()' in Godot_v2.1.4-stable_win64 crashes program
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 7 Home Premium 64, Godot_v2.1.4-stable_win64, GeForce GTX 970, driver version 10.18.13.5362

**Issue description:**
When testing shooting mechanic (instancing child scenes of bullets and shell casing objects) in game, debug screen is filled with errors of type 'Condition '!monitoring ' is true.returned: Array()' and game slows down considerably from 60 FPS to single-digit FPS in a matter of seconds and keeps slowing down even when new instances are no longer created. When the process is stopped, Godot is also sluggish and slow. No such issues in Godot_v2.1.3-rc1_win64.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Unknown. Probably linked to instancing of child scenes and collision detection. Attempts to replicate problem in simpler test project with similar script and scene setup did not work. 

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: GDScript: Make 'export' keyword serialize the field
data.body:
currently `export var x = 5` will just save the field along with scene file and show that variable in the editor.

there is `to_json()` function that can serialize any object, but feeding it a node with script just returns a class of the node, not even a name. (`"[Sprite:917]"`) which is useless.

so it would be very convenient if `export` will make a field serializable by `to_json()`.
for example i have a node somewhere on the scene with a script having export variables like:
```
extends Node

export var name = 'it's me, mario'
export var health = 99
```
and i want to save the current state, i just call `to_json(get_node('mario'))` and it will return those two variables as json, that i can add to the save file

data.title: Has_method is already provided by Object
data.body:
c812c17633 introduces some extra gdscript bindings for signal discovery
and adds a binding for has_method() to Script objects. This method is
already provided by the ancestor Object.

This fixes the startup message:
ERROR: bind_methodfi: Class Script already has a method has_method
   At: core/class_db.cpp:1178.

**Issue description:** Font rendering is poor-looking when using the MiDPI editor scaling setting. Note that this only happens on some texts, but not all.

![godot_midpi_font_rendering](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/180032/29958782-bc5d46ba-8ef4-11e7-9c16-bf51c7be8686.png)

**Steps to reproduce:** Set the editor scaling to MiDPI, then restart the editor. This issue also is visible in the project manager.

data.title: Adding custom input make Javascript and Android builds crash (Godot 3)
data.body:

)

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->

When you add a custom input action in a Godot 3 project, and you export to Android and Javascript versions it crash.

Android crash with this message:

```

09-01 03:01:38.332: A/DEBUG(637):     #00 pc 00ddbb80  /data/app/org.godotengine.testone-1/lib/arm/libgodot_android.so (_ZN15ProjectSettings21_load_settings_binaryE6String+1268)

09-01 03:01:38.333: A/DEBUG(637):     #05 pc 0033beab  /data/app/org.godotengine.testone-1/oat/arm/base.odex (offset 0x221000) (void org.godotengine.godot.Godot$1.run()+94)
09-01 03:01:38.989: E/InputDispatcher(1326): channel '75418fe org.godotengine.testone/org.godotengine.godot.Godot (server)' ~ Channel is unrecoverably broken and will be disposed!
```

Javascript crashes with this message:

```
**ERROR**: still waiting on run dependencies:
**ERROR**: dependency: wasm-instantiate

trap!
**ERROR**: trap!
**ERROR**: warning: build with  -s DEMANGLE_SUPPORT=1  to link in libcxxabi demangling
**ERROR**: exception thrown: abort("trap!") at jsStackTrace@file:///home/alexiarc/ww3/TestOne.js:1:18997
stackTrace@file:///home/alexiarc/ww3/TestOne.js:1:19168
abort@file:///home/alexiarc/ww3/TestOne.js:1:409631
_llvm_trap@file:///home/alexiarc/ww3/TestOne.js:1:220769
__ZN15ProjectSettings21_load_settings_binaryE6String@file:///home/alexiarc/ww3/TestOne.js:13550108:1
```

**Steps to reproduce:**

* Create a basic project
* Add a custom input action (like action_custom_one) and assign it a key

data.title: Optimize memory allocations in VariantParser::get_token
data.body:
This is optimization I made after profiling loading time of a game we're making. The game has lots of heavy scenes with meshes, animations and stuff, so parsing them became a bottleneck.
Apparently, there are a lot of redundant memory allocations inside `VariantParser::get_token`. I rewrote the code so it will use static buffer when possible.

Just a couple of screenshots - this is profiling results of loading phase of our game:
![before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20835548/29955946-c136eda8-8f0d-11e7-95bd-d961f9753487.png)
And this is the same loading after my optimization:
![after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20835548/29955986-0674016c-8f0e-11e7-9911-b3e35748281a.png)

And I'm aware that it's only actual for development builds (exported projects are unlikely to have this issue at all). Still, I think it won't hurt to merge.

data.title: Color.to_html() Produces odd results.
data.body:
Any RGB value >0 turns into FF. So for example `Color(255,100,0).to_html()` produces `ffffff00`.

I'm pretty sure the problem is in `String _to_hex(float p_val)` in `core/color.cpp`. I'd mess with it myself, but I can't get godot to compile :(

Tested in 2.1.4 x64, Ubuntu Linux

data.title: Deleting export preset clears a name of an item below
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot master branch 77ec304

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Deleting an export preset clears a name of an item below. Just the next one. Not above. Not further below. Probably other settings stay, just the name that is cleared.
It's a very old issue (earlier than May 2017) but I can't find any reports.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create two export presets of any platforms.
2. Delete the one above.
3. Notice that another one has a blank name.

data.title: Updated Editor Built-In types.
Fix importer not applying default settings
data.body:
## **Pull Request Description:**

As I previously mentioned on PR #10821, this PR fixes the remaining issues when re-importing assets using previously saved default settings.

## **Steps to reproduce:**

1. Open Godot editor (built using PR #10821 changes, so you can save defaults).
2. Select an importable asset from the FileSystem dock.
3. Navigate to the "Import" dock tab.
4. Modify any of the importer properties.
5. Click on "Preset > Set as default for 'type'".
6. Remove any '*.import' files from the project's FileSystem to trigger a re-import of those files.

**Results:** Assets get imported properly, but default setings do not get applied.
**Expected Results:** Assets should be re-imported and if there are any default settings saved they should be applied.
